sentences.chinese: 勇敢又勤懇，定能交好運。

sentences.english: And all of those hard working people down at the DMV need to be paid, too.
sentences.chinese: 那些在機動車部門勤勤懇懇工作的人也需要得到報酬。

sentences.english: Hardworking and eager to learn Strong responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 爲人勤懇好學，有一定的責任心。

sentences.english: I'm frightened my efforts were in vain.
sentences.chinese: 我憂慮我的勤懇全白費了。

sentences.english: These men are literally rebuilding the Sri Lankan railway.
sentences.chinese: 這些人正在勤勤懇懇地重建斯里蘭卡的鐵路。

sentences.english: He is not bright, but he always works hard.
sentences.chinese: 他並不聰明，但工作總是勤勤懇懇。

sentences.english: He is one of the most assiduous members of the team.
sentences.chinese: 他是該隊最勤懇努力的隊員之一。
我是一個很勤懇的園丁。

sentences.english: In a nation of overachievers, hard work is a virtue.
sentences.chinese: 在一個盡是頭等生的國度，勤懇是一種美德。
他們都是勤勤懇懇的人。
工作勤懇，有團隊協作精力。

sentences.english: Genius is nothing but lstomair conditionershor and diligence.
He enjoys the early morning. He feels good about being conscientious about his job.
sentences.chinese: 他享受清晨，爲自己勤勤懇懇的工作態度感覺良好。
她見到他在勤懇地工作。

sentences.english: He industriously engages in unostentatious hard work.

definition: see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
instructing with tireless zeal (idiom, from Analects)
to help the dying and heal the injured
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
